clinical_study.brief_title: High-flow Nasal Cannula Oxygen Therapy With the Chest Trauma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: High-flow Nasal Cannula Oxygen Therapy With the Chest Trauma Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective randomized controlled study was conducted in the emergency intensive care units (EICU) of the second affiliated hospital Zhejiang university school of medicine, a large tertiary university hospital in HangZhou, China.The aim of this randomized study was to compare the effectiveness of high-flow nasal cannula with conventional oxygen therapy in ICU patients with blunt thoracic injury.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective randomized controlled study was conducted in the emergency intensive care units (EICU) of the second affiliated hospital Zhejiang university school of medicine, a large tertiary university hospital in HangZhou, China.The aim of this randomized study was to compare the effectiveness of high-flow nasal cannula with conventional oxygen therapy in ICU patients with blunt thoracic injury.

primary_outcome.measure: compare the effectiveness of high-flow nasal cannula with conventional oxygen therapy in ICU patients with blunt thoracic injury.
primary_outcome.description: High-flow nasal cannula could reduce the intube rate of patients with blunt thoracic injury,and improve the the lung aeration for patients with thoracic injury

secondary_outcome.description: High-flow nasal cannula could reduce the number of days for the patients treatments in ICU

arm_group.description: oxygen was delivered by a nasal cannula or nonrebreather mask

intervention.description: high flow of air with supplemental oxygen was delivered by an Optiflow cannula interface using an AIRVO 2 blower humidifier
